cab.content: Printed for the War Cabinet. May 1944.SECRET. Copy No.W.P. (44) 264.23rd May, 1944.WAR CABINET.FUTURE RESPONSIBILITY FOR CIVIL AVIATION.Memorandum by the Lord Privy Seal.THE Civil Air Transport Committee has been charged by the War cabinet with the duty of making recommendations in relation to Ministerial responsibilityfor civil aviation after the, war and of advising whether any changes should bemade in the existing arrangements before the end of hostilities.2. On the 21st December, 1943, the Committee decided -the Secretary ofState for Air and the Paymaster-General dissenting to recommend that responsibility be transferred from the Air Ministry to the Minfstry of war transport. The Minister of War Transport, however, subsequently declared thatit was impossible for his Ministry to accept this responsibility at the present time.3. The Machinery of Government Committee recommended on the23rd February, 1944 ^the Secretary of State for Air dissenting- that theresponsibility for civil aviation should ultimately 4 after the war, be transferredto the Ministry of War Transport.4. I now ask the War Cabinet to decide that the civil aviation departmentof the Air Ministry should be transferred to the Ministry of War Transport sixmonths after the end of the war with Germany. The Minister of War Transportapproves of this recommendation.Gwydyr House, S.W. 1,23rd May, 1944.[27509]
